revised_title: An In-depth Study of the Wood-Peckers Tongue and its Mechanism
tldr: The author, Richard Waller, examines the unique structure and function of the woodpecker's tongue, detailing its remarkable ability to extend and retract with incredible speed to catch insects. He also compares and contrasts various theories and explanations from other researchers, providing his own insights and observations based on his study of multiple woodpecker specimens.
